Add "Project Goals 2017" to README.rst

Change-Id: I03df44f9779a643ae89514101f457990cd28bab4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/60/456560/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Project Goals 2017 ------------------ #. **Complete Mistral documentation**. Mistral documentation should be more usable. It requires focused work to make it well structured, eliminate gaps in API/DSL specifications, add more examples and tutorials. *Definition of done*: All capabilities are covered, all documentation topics are written using the same style and structure principles. The obvious sub-goal of this goal is to establish these principles. #. **Complete Mistral Custom Actions API**. There has been the initiative in Mistral team since April of 2016 to refactor Mistral actions subsystem in order to make the process of developing Mistral actions easier and clearer. In 2017 we need to complete this effort and make sure that all APIs are stable and it’s well-documented. *Definition of done*: All API interfaces are stable, existing actions are rewritten using this new API, OpenStack actions are also rewritten based on the new API and moved to mistral-extra repo. Everything is well documented and the doc has enough examples. #. **Finish Mistral multi-node mode**. Mistral needs to be proven to work reliably in multi-node mode. In order to achieve it we need to make a number of engine, executor and RPC changes and configure a CI gate to run stress tests on multi-node Mistral. *Definition of done*: CI gate supports MySQL, all critically important functionality (join, with-items, parallel workflows, sequential workflows) is covered by tests. #. **Reduce workflow execution time**. *Definition of done*: Average workflow execution time reduced by 30%.

commit_message:
Enable WSGI under Apache in devstack

Add support for enabling WSGI in Apache for the devstack plugin. This
will allow an additional CI gate.

Change-Id: I953dbdab71029b392f8846c50fa3d801c293cc5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/10/454710/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Toggle for deploying Mistral API under HTTPD + mod_wsgi MISTRAL_USE_MOD_WSGI=${MISTRAL_USE_MOD_WSGI:-True} MISTRAL_FILES_DIR=$MISTRAL_DIR/devstack/files MISTRAL_API_HOST=${MISTRAL_API_HOST:-$HOST_IP} MISTRAL_API_PORT=${MISTRAL_API_PORT:-8989} MISTRAL_SERVICE_USER=${MISTRAL_SERVICE_USER:-mistral} if [ "$MISTRAL_USE_MOD_WSGI" == "True" ]; then _config_mistral_apache_wsgi fi if [ "$MISTRAL_USE_MOD_WSGI" == "True" ]; then install_apache_wsgi fi # If the site is not enabled then we are in a grenade scenario local enabled_site_file enabled_site_file=$(apache_site_config_for mistral-api) if [ -f ${enabled_site_file} ] && [ "$MISTRAL_USE_MOD_WSGI" == "True" ]; then run_process mistral-engine "$MISTRAL_BIN_DIR/mistral-server --server engine --config-file $MISTRAL_CONF_DIR/mistral.conf" run_process mistral-executor "$MISTRAL_BIN_DIR/mistral-server --server executor --config-file $MISTRAL_CONF_DIR/mistral.conf" run_process mistral-event-engine "$MISTRAL_BIN_DIR/mistral-server --server event-engine --config-file $MISTRAL_CONF_DIR/mistral.conf" enable_apache_site mistral-api restart_apache_server tail_log mistral-api /var/log/$APACHE_NAME/mistral_api.log elif is_service_enabled mistral-api && is_service_enabled mistral-engine && is_service_enabled mistral-executor && is_service_enabled mistral-event-engine ; then local serv for serv in mistral mistral-engine mistral-executor mistral-event-engine; do if [ "$HEAT_USE_MOD_WSGI" == "True" ]; disable_apache_site mistral-api restart_apache_server else stop_process mistral-api fi if [ "$MISTRAL_USE_MOD_WSGI" == "True" ]; then _mistral_cleanup_apache_wsgi fi sudo rm -rf $MISTRAL_CONF_DIRfunction _mistral_cleanup_apache_wsgi { sudo rm -f $(apache_site_config_for mistral-api) } # _config_mistral_apache_wsgi() - Set WSGI config files for Mistral function _config_mistral_apache_wsgi { local mistral_apache_conf mistral_apache_conf=$(apache_site_config_for mistral-api) local mistral_ssl="" local mistral_certfile="" local mistral_keyfile="" local mistral_api_port=$MISTRAL_API_PORT local venv_path="" sudo cp $MISTRAL_FILES_DIR/apache-mistral-api.template $mistral_apache_conf sudo sed -e " s|%PUBLICPORT%|$mistral_api_port|g; s|%APACHE_NAME%|$APACHE_NAME|g; s|%HEAT_BIN_DIR%|$MISTRAL_BIN_DIR|g; s|%API_WORKERS%|$API_WORKERS|g; s|%SSLENGINE%|$mistral_ssl|g; s|%SSLCERTFILE%|$mistral_certfile|g; s|%SSLKEYFILE%|$mistral_keyfile|g; s|%USER%|$STACK_USER|g; s|%VIRTUALENV%|$venv_path|g " -i $mistral_apache_conf }
deleted_lines: if is_service_enabled mistral-api && is_service_enabled mistral-engine && is_service_enabled mistral-executor && is_service_enabled mistral-event-engine ; then for serv in mistral mistral-api mistral-engine mistral-executor mistral-event-engine; do

commit_message:
Agent-side receiver cache for ML2 OVO

Logic for subscribing to RPC callbacks, flooding the initial cache,
storing updates, and generating local callback events.

To see how this will be used, see Change
Ib2234ec1f5d328649c6bb1c3fe07799d3e351f48.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: I71f4f5b5ed4e19b8a70a65d22b5378be44d2bd73

subject: Change the Next button to Validate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 07:04:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral-dashboard/commit/0842d72dc38cb2a9e8cbbae34c2da0c1f78222d4', 'message': 'Change the Next button to Validate

In Workbooks -> Create Workbook, when we choose “Direct input” for
“Definition source” field and enter a workbook definition it
proposes to click “Next” button and then on the next screen we
finally see “Create” button. If clicking “Next” does validation
then it is not obvious for the user. So, change the button to
"Validate".

Change-Id: I5a795c08a3b7252f330d976204238a7d27539770
Closes-Bug: #bug/1648390

commit_message:
Change the Next button to Validate

In Workbooks -> Create Workbook, when we choose “Direct input” for
“Definition source” field and enter a workbook definition it
proposes to click “Next” button and then on the next screen we
finally see “Create” button. If clicking “Next” does validation
then it is not obvious for the user. So, change the button to
"Validate".

Change-Id: I5a795c08a3b7252f330d976204238a7d27539770
Closes-Bug: 1648390

scenario test: configure scenario test protocols

scenario tests.

commit_message:
Add monitorstack to OpenStack-Ansible

The monitorstack repository is now curated by the OpenStack-Ansible
community, with the aim of creating a monitoring plugin framework for
OpenStack clouds.

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import abc import six from six.moves.urllib import parse as urlparse @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class Resource(object): """Base class for operations on REST API resources.""" def __init__(self, client): self.client = client @abc.abstractproperty def url(self): """Base URL of the resource.""" @abc.abstractproperty def fields(self): """List of fields to be used in representation of the resource.""" def get(self, uuid, raise_not_found=True): url = urlparse.urljoin(self.url + '/', uuid) resource = self.client.get(url).json() return (self.fields, tuple(resource[f] for f in self.fields)) def list(self, filters=None): if filters: urlencoded_filters = urlparse.urlencode(filters) url = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, '?' + urlencoded_filters) else: url = self.url resources = self.client.get(url).json().items()[0][1] # FIXME return (self.fields, [tuple(row[f] for f in self.fields) for row in resources]) def create(self, data=None): data = data or {} resp_created = self.client.post(self.url, data=data) resource = self.client.get(resp_created.headers['Location']).json() return (self.fields, tuple(resource[f] for f in self.fields)) def update(self, uuid, data): url = urlparse.urljoin(self.url + '/', uuid) resource = self.client.put(url, data=data).json() return (self.fields, tuple(resource[f] for f in self.fields)) def delete(self, uuid, raise_not_found=True): url = urlparse.urljoin(self.url + '/', uuid) return self.client.delete(url)

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service version

* bump bifrost from 3.0.0 to 3.1.0
* bump cinder from 10.0.0 to 10.0.1
* bump gnocchi from 3.1.1 to 3.1.2
* bump ironic from 7.0.0 to 7.0.1
* bump kuryr-lib from 0.3.0 to 0.4.0
* move to kuryr-libnetwork from master to 0.1.0
* bump monasca-log-api from 1.4.0 to 1.4.1
* bump neutron from 10.0.0 to 10.0.1
* bump neutron-fwaas from 10.0.0 to 10.0.1
* bump nova from 15.0.2 to  15.0.3
* bump panko from 2.0.1 to 2.0.2

Change-Id: I4a98d25ab1e55a534106bfaee87ebe54c6589672

commit_message:
Limit db consistency and refresher to first class mdoels

Models which are not first-class do not reside in the database.
Therefore, there is little point in keeping their consistency and
refreshing them. This change verifies this doesn't happen.

Change-Id: I17d2bb7f0fa3d08a28a5546ee14d9ce62e12687e

commit_message:
Migrate Swift ring handling from tripleo-heat-templates to puppet-tripleo

This allows decoupling the Swift ringbuilding logic from the Controller
and ObjectStorage roles. A follow up patch will modify
tripleo-heat-templates and use this modified class.

Actually this downloads the Swift rings even if ring building is
disabled or if there is no need to rebalance. This is required, because
operators can disable ring building, but use the same mechanism to
distribute pre-built rings to the nodes.

If ring building is disabled, these won't be uploaded at the end back to
the undercloud.

Related-Bug: 1665641
Change-Id: Ifd6fa5b398d98e8998630ea0c9a2ce9867ceba2b
(cherry picked from commit 3412150d91dc7fe6e9f168b4ffdbb4d54c39fc55)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/74/455074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*swift_ring_get_tempurl*] # GET tempurl to fetch Swift rings from # # [*swift_ring_put_tempurl*] # PUT tempurl to upload Swift rings to # $swift_ring_get_tempurl = hiera('swift_ring_get_tempurl', ''), $swift_ring_put_tempurl = hiera('swift_ring_put_tempurl', ''), ) { if $step == 2 and $swift_ring_get_tempurl != '' { exec{'fetch_swift_ring_tarball': path => ['/usr/bin'], command => "curl --insecure --silent '${swift_ring_get_tempurl}' -o /tmp/swift-rings.tar.gz", returns => [0, 3] } ~> exec{'extract_swift_ring_tarball': path => ['/bin'], command => 'tar xzf /tmp/swift-rings.tar.gz -C /', returns => [0, 2] } } if $step == 5 and $build_ring and $swift_ring_put_tempurl != '' { exec{'create_swift_ring_tarball': path => ['/bin', '/usr/bin'], command => 'tar cvzf /tmp/swift-rings.tar.gz /etc/swift/*.builder /etc/swift/*.ring.gz /etc/swift/backups/', unless => 'swift-recon --md5 | grep -q "doesn\'t match"' } ~> exec{'upload_swift_ring_tarball': path => ['/usr/bin'], command => "curl --insecure --silent -X PUT '${$swift_ring_put_tempurl}' --data-binary @/tmp/swift-rings.tar.gz", require => Exec['create_swift_ring_tarball'], refreshonly => true, } }

commit_message:
Only show image name as a link when the image exists

Updated the nova api to return None when the image name
is not available, for example, when it's deleted.

Added a check for the image name before showing it as
a link.

Change-Id: I342b23dfd8352182f50c41054d2dbb3eae854839
Closes-bug:1668783

commit_message:
Set fluentd output to elasticsearch to use elasticsearch_address

Haproxy binds the elasticsearch service to kolla_internal_vip_address but
the output templates for fluentd (td-agent) point to a non-existent
kolla_external_vip_address.

Output should also be able to be sent to an external elasticsearch
instance (as per the documentation regarding overriding
elasticsearch_address)

Change these settings so that fluentd outputs to either
the default elasticsearch_address (i.e. kolla_internal_vip_address) or to
the external elasticsearch instance.

Closes-Bug: #1673990
Change-Id: I081533ae8ea9aad186e9c44e1dee069729931453
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/54/447654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: },{% if enable_elasticsearch | bool or ( elasticsearch_address != kolla_internal_vip_address ) | bool %}

commit_message:
Adding securing sensitive data spec

* A specification for the blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/secure-sensitive-data

Change-Id: I3180f30b2b41191f10228913bce1c66d0918c976
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral-specs refs/changes/53/450853/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================= Securing Sensitive Data ======================= Launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-secure-sensitive-data This specification describes additions/changes to the DSL to allow a workflow author to describe fields that should be treated as sensitive. By marking a field as sensitive, it will signal that the engine should redact said field from logs. Additionally, a decarator will be made available to Action developers to mark parameters as secret, thus treating them in a sensitive way. Problem description =================== Currently, there is no regard for sensitive data when writing information to logs, and other places, mainly because Mistral is agnostic to the values passed to it. It cannot currently distinguish sensitive data from "normal" data. In order for Mistral to make this distinction, some additions to the DSL must be made in order to signify data that is sensitive, and should be redacted. Use Cases --------- Hiding passwords from logs ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ As a workflow author, I want to have a password as input, and when Mistral logs information about my workflow, I do not want the password to be in plain text. It should be displayed as '*********'. Proposed change =============== Add a 'secret' section to the workflow DSL. Add a decorator to be used when developing custom actions. Create a special data type, for example class Secured, with string representation "******" so that if something is wrapped into it we'll never see it in logs in its initial form. Store Secured instances in encoded form in DB, decode them when fetched from DB. --- version: "2.0" wf: input: - username secret: - keyA tasks: taskA: action: my_action publish: keyA: <% task(taskA).result.foobar %> on-success: - taskB taskB: action: my_action2 input: arg1: <% $.keyA %> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ how do we know that arg1 should now be secret? is that an issue?? rom mistral_lib.secret import protect @protect(['password']) class MyAction(Action): def init(self, password): # do something Alternatives ------------ tasks: taskA: action: my_action protected: - password input: password: <%...%> tasks: taskA: action: my_action input: username: <% ... %> password: $.secret(<% ... %>) Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. End user impact --------------- REST API users ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ No impact. Custom actions developers ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Can use the decorator to mark sensitive inputs. Workflow developers ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Can use the 'secret' section to signify sensitive fields. Performance Impact ------------------ No significant impact is expected. Minor is possible. Deployer impact --------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- To be found based on discussions around the spec. Work Items ---------- * Implement new section 'secret' in workflow DSL * Implement new decorator for custom actions * Store secret data to DB in some type of encoded form. Dependencies ============ No additional dependencies are required. Testing ======= The action decorator can be tested via unit tests. The workflow DSL additions will likely need to be tested on devstack via tempest. References ========== Launchpad bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1337268

WiP: Autogeneration of ceph.conf files

This commit implements autogeneration of ceph.conf files for each of
Cinder RBD backend configured in values.yaml.

commit_message:
Replace uuid.uuid4() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function to generate uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I7767ede62df3a5bdce7f62227ada1f7f6dcad4b6
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
Enable cluster trust for magnum

This enable cluster_user_trust which is needed to get Kubernetes
integration with Cinder and Neutron LBaaS.

Fedora images for Ocata have been updated in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452102/. This commit also fixes the
gate.

Change-Id: Ie95c45f84381b0d278dafa6a3227f787ece83323
(cherry picked from commit aceaa3e5f174af1e40060440c025f49cd1875e0b)

commit_message:
Cleanup /run/netns host directory volume mount

"/run/:/run/:shared" is previously declare as "mounted" in container,
hence "/run/netns/:/run/netns/:shared" directory volume mount is not
required and must be removed.

Related-Bug: #1683584
Change-Id: Ia7032843c493e8a883edd2f4ec12e0fdefc823a3
(cherry picked from commit 321a6e54842febcabbb1ca19f52bd40187ca75ab)

subject: Make a2dissite fail softly if the site is not enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 15:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['lib/apache'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2fcdaac56e20f1002ae76c6ae1b30a093452d21b', 'message': 'Make a2dissite fail softly if the site is not enabled

a2dissite will return a non-zero error code if the site that is being
disabled is not currently enabled (that is, if the conf file for it does
not exist). This can happen during development if you've been messing
with files by hand. Rather than exploding out of a ./stack.sh, accept
the missing file as meaning "it's disabled" and carry one. The rpm
version of disable, which does not use a2dissite, does this already.

Change-Id: Ie5dfd42efdff4bdba5ffaa765af000dd8e1d596e
'}]
commit_message:
Make a2dissite fail softly if the site is not enabled

a2dissite will return a non-zero error code if the site that is being
disabled is not currently enabled (that is, if the conf file for it does
not exist). This can happen during development if you've been messing
with files by hand. Rather than exploding out of a ./stack.sh, accept
the missing file as meaning "it's disabled" and carry one. The rpm
version of disable, which does not use a2dissite, does this already.

Change-Id: Ie5dfd42efdff4bdba5ffaa765af000dd8e1d596e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/05/457705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
neutron_vpnaas_agent: kolla_docker parameter 'volumes' is wrong

In task "Running Neutron vpnaas bootstrap container",
parameter "volumes" of kolla_docker should be
"{{ neutron_vpnaas_agent.volumes }}"
NOT
"{{ neutron_vpnaas_agent.image }}"

Change-Id: Id7c95d4d6f53dfab384e387951eecf4d87459de
Closes-Bug: #1683669
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/05/457505/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

neutron_vpnaas_agent: kolla_docker parameter 'volumes' is wrong

In task "Running Neutron vpnaas bootstrap container",
parameter "volumes" of kolla_docker should be
"{{ neutron_vpnaas_agent.volumes }}"
NOT
"{{ neutron_vpnaas_agent.image }}"

subject: Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 17:18:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/89ae1dd1d94fdeecf45813828fd21795f00a691a', 'message': 'Fix KeyeEror in get_isolated_subnets

At present dhcp agents sync networks/subnets/ports by calling rpc api
get_active_networks_info() when restart. It filters subnets with
"enable_dhcp=True", which is inconsistent with what get_network_info()
does, and will cause KeyError in get_isolated_subnets() executed by dhcp
agent. Besides, routes for neighbor IPv4 subnets in a network would be
incomplete due to it.

This patch remove enable_dhcp filter of subnet query in
get_active_networks_info().

Change-Id: Ia3acb3ec803e76ca691ac1eab55d54ffcf6af310
Closes-Bug: 1611060
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 03:19:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/92a6c67c99318d925dd406bac1399747bacd284f', 'message': 'Fix KeyError in get_isolated_subnets

At present dhcp agents sync networks/subnets/ports by calling rpc api
get_active_networks_info() when restart. It filters subnets with
"enable_dhcp=True", which is inconsistent with what get_network_info()
does, and will cause KeyError in get_isolated_subnets() executed by dhcp
agent. Besides, routes for neighbor IPv4 subnets in a network would be
incomplete due to it.

This patch remove enable_dhcp filter of subnet query in
get_active_networks_info().

Change-Id: Ia3acb3ec803e76ca691ac1eab55d54ffcf6af310
Closes-Bug: 1611060
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-26 17:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c2c9550cf4dbe4d7629bc2177d9d1d9ad2103435', 'message': 'Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when network contains more that one IPv4 subnets,
report these subnets in 'classless-static-routes' DHCP option.

However, the get_active_networks_info method used for synchronize
networks after dhcp agents restart filter subnets with
"enable_dhcp=True", which differ from the get_network_info method. This
will cause VMs can't access the other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets
in the same network.

This patch remove enable_dhcp filter of subnet query in the
get_active_networks_info method.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: Ia3acb3ec803e76ca691ac1eab55d54ffcf6af310
Closes-Bug: #1652654
Related-Bug: #1372885
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lack of routes for neighbour IPv4 subnets

According to [1], when network contains more that one IPv4 subnets,
report these subnets in 'classless-static-routes' DHCP option.

However, the get_active_networks_info method used for synchronize
networks after dhcp agents restart filter subnets with
"enable_dhcp=True", which differ from the get_network_info method. This
will cause VMs can't access the other VMs in the dhcp disabled subnets
in the same network.

This patch remove enable_dhcp filter of subnet query in the
get_active_networks_info method.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125043/

Change-Id: Ia3acb3ec803e76ca691ac1eab55d54ffcf6af310
Closes-Bug: #1652654
Related-Bug: #1372885

commit_message:
Pause and unpause actions for a stack

Currently suspending and resuming of stack is available.
This blueprint is to allow two more actions i.e pause and
unpause of stack from heat command line.

Implements: blueprint heat-stack-pause-unpause

Change-Id: I41a27a822142dd21b56d9baee52aa404ea115d6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/24/187524/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ======================================= Pause, Unpause options for entire stack ======================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/heat-stack-pause-unpause Currently suspending and resuming of stack is available. This blueprint is to allow two more actions i.e pause and unpause of stack from heat command line. Problem description =================== In heat, the current action availble to halt a stack is through action suspend. Their is a difference between "pause" and "suspend", pause is similar to "sleep" and suspend is similar to "hybernation". One of the use case for pausing a stack would be when a user wants to get the backup of stacks, as stack's instances may be writing data to disks. Proposed change =============== The proposal is to allow two actions pause and upause for a given stack. The proposed changes will come now: 1.The request for stack pause/unpause from the user reaches the heat client. 2.Heat-client gets the parametres(stack name or stack id) from the request and sends to the heat-api. 3.Heat-api sends the request to the heat-engine. 4.Heat-engine fetches the instance details for the given stack. 5.Heat-engine sends the request to the nova for pausing the instances of the given stack, using nova's API's. Alternatives ------------ Use nova command line or horizon to get the details of instances of a stack and iteratively pause each instance of the stack. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: rsritesh Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: liberty-1 Work Items ---------- * Add two new commands, as follows : For stack-pause heat action-pause <stack-id> or <stack name> For stack-unpause heat action-unpause <stack-id> or <stack name> * Add changes in heat client * Add changes in heat-api and heat engine * Add required additional test cases. * Add documentation for CLI (python-heatclient), REST API (api-sites) Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Migrate the entire running stack

A option to migrate the entire stack from existing/running computes
hosts to another computes host.

Change-Id: I8fea02b91e983fe133296b07f8982fcd4dc973de
Implements: blueprint heat-entire-stack-migration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/32/172632/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= Stack migration ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/heat-entire-stack-migration The stack can be migrated from one host to another host. This migration can enhance the scalability of the stacks.There can be many reasons to migrate the stack from one host to another.We can load-balance the hosts using migration. The entire stack can be migrated to the specified host at a go. Instead of manually migrating the instances of the stack to another host, the entire stack can be migrated. For example a host Host1 has two stacks running on it. And each stack contains 10 instances. If the entire stack has to migrated to Host2, using the current version, it has to be done manually one after the other. Stack migration can reduce the time and make it relatively easy to migrate the entire stack. It is used primarily to achieve almost zero downtime during cloud maintenance and can also be a useful feature to achieve performance as live stacks can be moved from a heavily loaded compute node to a less loaded compute node. Problem description =================== When the host (Host1) is overloaded with many stacks and wants to transfer the load (stack) to another host (Host2), it cannot transfer the entire stack to Host2 at a go. To overcome this problem, new heat commands "stack-live-migrate" for live migration and "stack-migrate" for non-live migration are developed which migrate the entire stack from one host (Host1) to another (Host2). In Openstack, a stack-create command can launch a stack ( a group of instances or any other resources in OpenStack). A single instance can be migrated using nova live-migration command but not the entire stack(group of instances). Proposed change =============== Two new APIs are created in heat for live and non-live migration. Request for stack migration comes to the heat client which will further process the request. The proposed change will come now : 1.The request for stack migration from the user reaches the heat client. 2.The heat client gets the parameters from the request (stack name and host name) and hits the heat-api. 3.The heat-api routes the request to heat engine. 4.The heat engine fetches the instances from the specified heat stack. 5.The heat engine sends request to nova for migrating the stack to the host specified by the user using nova APIs. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== New commands to do heat migration, shown as below: For live-migration: heat stack-live-migrate --hostname <hostname> <stack-name> For non-live migration: heat stack-migrate --hostname <hostname> <stack-name> These command invoke the heat APIs and communicate with Nova migration APIs to peform stack migration. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: liberty-1 Work Items ---------- The work items can be divided as following : * Implement a new command for stack-migrate in heat. * Implement Heat API to support stack live migration. * create a new function in heat engine which invokes nova API for live migration. * Integration of Heat client and Heat API server. Dependencies ============ None REST API impact --------------- The entire stack is migrated from one host to another host.For example, there are two host machines Host1 and Host2. when a stack is launched,some of the instances may be created in Host1 and some in Host2.The entire stack has to be migrated to Host2. The nova conductor checks the location of the instances and migrates only those instances which are not present on the destination host. So,only those instances running on Host1 will be migrated to Host2. The inputs required are the 1. Name of the stack 2. Destination host. Name of the stack: The stack which needs to be migrated from one host to another should be provided. Destination host: The host to which the stack must be migrated is to be provided as a parameter to the command. Note that the destination host must be different from the source host itself.Since stack cannot be transfered back to the source itself. Documentation Impact ==================== We will write the documentation for all the changes.

commit_message:
grafana: add ceph dashboard

This dashboard contains a graph that plots ceph failures against the
default job.  This should help us to more easily monitor the health of
the ceph jobs, in the interest of becoming voting in the future.

Change-Id: I01c652bfce601e33e05ae92b5482bbc7f1fee979
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/93/449293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Disable py35 functional job for networking-ovn

The gate hook doesn't even support it. Apparently, the job was added
later in Ocata but never got disabled for Newton and earlier.

Change-Id: I57fd5b0a8bfbb0e35eedfc1d9c3172c8dddd37a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/72/457672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Storlets: Use python-jobs instead of parts indivisually

Before this change we cannot see the docs build result in the gerrit
gate. I'd like to use python-jobs (and python35-jobs) instead of adding
gate-storlets-docs-ubuntu-xenial, that covers what we want.

Change-Id: Icce45a2d96fe62ae1fcd77a5615d686df9a7e580

subject: Re-add containers experimental jobs to tripleo-ci
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 12:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b160ca1177be93dcb18994618cc609e893375b52', 'message': "Re-add containers experimental jobs to tripleo-ci

In I42a5667770f327a973f2661f7ad3a844610f6327 I'm trying to
adjust the ovb-containers-oooq job but it appears to no longer
be running in the tripleo-experimental queue for tripleo-ci.

We should consider running all tripleo-experimental jobs
for tripleo-ci. Until I figure out why we aren't lets just
enable this single job again.

Change-Id: I30a431ccb330f89f9b2f2e78da444e1358abd181
"}]
commit_message:
Re-add containers experimental jobs to tripleo-ci

In I42a5667770f327a973f2661f7ad3a844610f6327 I'm trying to
adjust the ovb-containers-oooq job but it appears to no longer
be running in the tripleo-experimental queue for tripleo-ci.

We should consider running all tripleo-experimental jobs
for tripleo-ci. Until I figure out why we aren't lets just
enable this single job again.

Change-Id: I30a431ccb330f89f9b2f2e78da444e1358abd181
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/457615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Set LIVE_MIGRATE_BACK_AND_FORTH=True for grenade live-migration job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 03:00:48.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7517e7d16c8753cb320b5bc51ed3b6b2298a8d49', 'message': 'Set LIVE_MIGRATE_BACK_AND_FORTH=True for grenade live-migration job

This makes the grenade live-migration job run live-migration
on a single instance to one compute node and then back to the
other, which is interesting in a grenade job where we have
mixed computes.

Change-Id: I06eb67105a36d3770febd400465edc0ca711c0cc
Depends-On: I8da2b3bd0c08d9a3111d3531c346d06bd52cae7b
'}]
commit_message:
Set LIVE_MIGRATE_BACK_AND_FORTH=True for grenade live-migration job

This makes the grenade live-migration job run live-migration
on a single instance to one compute node and then back to the
other, which is interesting in a grenade job where we have
mixed computes.

Change-Id: I06eb67105a36d3770febd400465edc0ca711c0cc
Depends-On: I8da2b3bd0c08d9a3111d3531c346d06bd52cae7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/48/431848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # LIVE_MIGRATE_BACK_AND_FORTH will tell Tempest to run a live # migration of the same instance to one compute node and then back # to the other, which is mostly only interesting for grenade since # we have mixed level computes. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"LIVE_MIGRATE_BACK_AND_FORTH=True"

Add ironic-pxe-snmp gate to virtualpdu

This prepare the terrain for integration of a new devstack plugin that
might break ironic.

Add shaker test for cluster in upgrade

for Mitaka to Newton

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/performance-docs refs/changes/74/457274/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This test plan covers basic network performance with long-running test suites to verify cloud network stability and performance during update Open Stack from Mitaka to Newton.
deleted_lines: This document is inspired by :ref:`openstack_control_plane_performance_test_plan`, and aims to cover baseline cloud operations and extend this test suite to verify containerized deployment approach. As :ref:`openstack_control_plane_performance_test_plan` this test plan covers basic cloud operation VMs creation, as well as long-running test suites to verify cloud stability during update Open Stack from Mitaka to Newton.

commit_message:
Remove a TODO that no longer applies

The removed TODO was talking about USE_SYSTEMD, not WSGI_MODE.

WSGI_MODE makes sense, so the TODO has been done.

Change-Id: Ib574ef123ea4c82d4d88012c990cd1ad660d7879

commit_message:
api test: Add config options for listener/pool protocol

Background: Some backend (eg. midonet) don't support HTTP.
It's useful to be able to run tests with eg. TCP for such
deployments.  This is planned to be used on networking-midonet
gate jobs.

Related-Bug: #1652561
Change-Id: I6f106b643a3485d36410e5459e91f829df35cb25

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg lbaas_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='lbaas', title='Neutron LBaaS Options') lbaas_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('default_listener_protocol', default='HTTP', help='Default protocol for Neutron LBaaS Listeners'), cfg.StrOpt('default_pool_protocol', default='HTTP', help='Default protocol for Neutron LBaaS Pools'), ]

commit_message:
Test using UCA for libvirt 2.5.0

We have had issues with libvirt 1.3.1 which is stock on Xenial. Try
using 2.5.0 from UCA instead.

Related-Bug: 1643911
Related-Bug: 1646779
Related-Bug: 1638982
Change-Id: Ia4434541c71f050fe1ffb54f4c4c1e302391d00b
(cherry picked from commit c9a9e415b9a955525a407b78650f93e9193c8117)

added_lines: if [[ "$os_VENDOR" =~ (Debian|Ubuntu) ]]; then # The groups change with newer libvirt. Older Ubuntu used # 'libvirtd', but now uses libvirt like Debian. Do a quick check # to see if libvirtd group already exists to handle grenade's case. LIBVIRT_GROUP=$(cut -d ':' -f 1 /etc/group | grep 'libvirtd$' || true) LIBVIRT_GROUP=${LIBVIRT_GROUP:-libvirt}

commit_message:
Add networking with vmware vsphere

Vmware vsphere support by nova-network.

The path support nova-network service with the VlanManager
by vsphere vswitch.

see
https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/compute/hypervisor-vmware.html

Change-Id: Idcaaff7403e0842708a1a5a768553f6c98bd6484

commit_message:
Skip the qos test cases

Since neutron changes qos notification driver to qos driver, code in
DF needs update. This patch skip the related test cases first, so
that the gate will not be blocked.

Change-Id: Ic60b34d59e15b007a6750d4a5674b0591f459d19
Related-Bug: #1683784

deleted_lines: from zun import objects def pause(self, container): """Pause a running container.""" if isinstance(container, objects.Container): container = container.container_id super(DockerHTTPClient, self).pause(container) def unpause(self, container): """Unpause a paused container.""" if isinstance(container, objects.Container): container = container.container_id super(DockerHTTPClient, self).unpause(container)

subject: XenAPI: Remove final references to Integration bridge
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-10 05:39:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/c5b0374e31694257f6f61b659d8fdcb4e388f6c0', 'message': 'XenAPI: Remove kernal args when creating DomU

Now we have changed q-domua (neutron-ovs-agent in compute node) to
use the common integration bridge br-int, we should delete the xen
function which requires it to set PV args.

Change-Id: Ia568462c9cca8cff8fcfada8148d185609d61a7d
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-10 05:56:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/ebc330c0514e9b215e9c25db2f6594151025fb04', 'message': 'enAPI: Don't set guest name alone when create domU

We have change q-domua to use br-int as OVS integration bridge,
and removed to set it in tools/xen/install_os_domU.sh, see
append_kernel_cmdline "$GUEST_NAME", but only doing this isn't
correct, there are two reasons:
1. function append_kernel_cmdline() requires two input params
2. Line:296 in install_os_domU.sh will set the GUEST_NAME again,
so we need to delete the setting of GUEST_NAME alone and this
patch is to fix this problem

Change-Id: Ia568462c9cca8cff8fcfada8148d185609d61a7d
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-10 05:56:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/4724b1ea88a130e677bcf429a75d85f5ba302e80', 'message': 'XenAPI: Don't set guest name alone when create domU

We have change q-domua to use br-int as OVS integration bridge,
and removed to set it in tools/xen/install_os_domU.sh, see
append_kernel_cmdline "$GUEST_NAME", but only doing this isn't
correct, there are two reasons:
1. function append_kernel_cmdline() requires two input params
2. Line:296 in install_os_domU.sh will set the GUEST_NAME again,
so we need to delete the setting of GUEST_NAME alone and this
patch is to fix this problem

Change-Id: Ia568462c9cca8cff8fcfada8148d185609d61a7d
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-10 06:27:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2ec47e726d1f251d57d377a13116b623a077625a', 'message': 'XenAPI: Don't set guest name alone when create domU

We have changed q-domua to use br-int as OVS integration bridge,
and removed configuring it in tools/xen/install_os_domU.sh, see
append_kernel_cmdline "$GUEST_NAME", but only doing this isn't
correct:
function append_kernel_cmdline() requires two input params, it's
not correct to only pass $GUEST_NANE and since we don't need to
set XEN_INTEGRATION_BRIDGE_DEFAULT as PV args, there is no need
to call this function at all

Change-Id: Ia568462c9cca8cff8fcfada8148d185609d61a7d
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2017-04-11 01:25:40.000000000', 'files': ['tools/xen/install_os_domU.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2a2db2efc522306acf90b2fb9cf0106cf7cf8e6d', 'message': 'XenAPI: Remove final references to Integration bridge

The change to remove references of XEN_INTEGRATION_BRIDGE
(If5886e3711765a97f40f20e478f958b988b5a620) unfortunately left some
code which should have been removed.  This remaining code caused an
error in some situations when deploying from scratch (which the CI
avoids for expediency)

Change-Id: Ia568462c9cca8cff8fcfada8148d185609d61a7d
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Remove final references to Integration bridge

The change to remove references of XEN_INTEGRATION_BRIDGE
(If5886e3711765a97f40f20e478f958b988b5a620) unfortunately left some
code which should have been removed.  This remaining code caused an
error in some situations when deploying from scratch (which the CI
avoids for expediency)

Change-Id: Ia568462c9cca8cff8fcfada8148d185609d61a7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/23/455123/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: local kernel_args kernel_args="$2" xe vm-param-set PV-args="$pv_args $kernel_args" uuid=$vm

commit_message:
Supports adding tags for port, router, subnet, subnetpool

Neutron supports adding tags for several resources:
network, port, subnet, subnetpool, router,
but neutronclient only support to add tags for network,
support for others .

Change-Id: Iae8da2fa0e18e14ba27ce5232db8da5fe6eb0b86
Closes-Bug: #1676697

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-18 15:39:46.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tls'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/be92aa8eb4b5db2b4a2f1e9715dfae4ab6fe2b47', 'message': "always retry proxy errors

When an apache worker gets a proxy error, it will not retry talking to

commit_message:
always retry proxy errors

When an apache worker gets a proxy error, it will not retry talking to
the backend server until the retry timeout expires. We bring up the
proxy server *before* the backend server, and poll it. If we are
running a small number of workers, there is a likely chance that we're
going to hit one that errored before the backend was up, thus failing
for now real reason.

Set this to 0 instead to mean always retry failed connections.

Change-Id: I9e584f087bd375f71ddf0c70f83205c425094a17
Ref: https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#proxypass
(cherry picked from commit a1446b960fa7c21bc1e7141921d6fc95c6e212d2)

commit_message:
Use tripleo profile for bigswitch agent

For ease of backporting, we originally just included the neutron agent
configuration for bigswitch within THT directly. This change updates it
to use a profile which is a best practice when configuring a service.

Change-Id: I1c4dfe803fd372fb5db981a9e9a9b0ac7cb3763f
Depends-On: I7a8f7f73c9c8446e21c16a5c378bd7e0f0a4c94e
Closes-Bug: #1674791

commit_message:
Automatically backup and restore Swift rings from the undercloud

Swift rings created or updated on the overcloud nodes will now be
stored on the undercloud at the end of the deployment.  An
additional consistency check is executed before storing them,
ensuring all rings within the cluster are identical.

These rings will be retrieved (before Puppet runs) by every node
when an UPDATE is executed, and by doing this will be in a
consistent state across the cluster.

This makes it possible to add, remove or replace nodes in an
existing cluster without manual operator interaction.

Closes-Bug: 1609421
Depends-On: Ic3da38cffdd993c768bdb137c17d625dff1aa372
Change-Id: I758179182265da5160c06bb95f4c6258dc0edcd6
(cherry picked from commit b323f8a16035549d84cdec4718380bde3d23d6c3)
